thread.title: People will be kept up-to-date, says Prayut
thread.title_full: People will be kept up-to-date, says Prayut

title: People will be kept up-to-date, says Prayut
text: Home » politics » People will be kept up-to-date, says Prayut People will be kept up-to-date, says Prayut The Nation October 14, 2015 1:00 am Prime Minister General Prayut Chan-o-cha said yesterday that he would continue delivering his message to people as it was necessary to keep them informed, especially during this period of reform. "I will continue sending messages related to important matters that have an effect on society. From now until July 2017 [planned election], the country will be under reform and people should know what the government is doing during this critical period," he said. His messages have been delivered to people through Government Spokesman Maj-General Sansern Kaewkamnerd over the past few days. When asked why he did not deliver the messages himself, he said some necessary matters had to be officially announced. Prayut also called on those who have different views to not just talk about conflicts but also address the root problems. "I am not blaming anybody, but this is the time to work together under reform," he said. 457 Viewed
